description:
Major Purpose

Job Description:

  • Under close supervision of the Lead and/or Production Supervisor, this position is responsible for simple and repetitive job assignments, consisting of both Magnetic and Electro Mechanical assembly work ranging from simple to semi-complex in accordance with work order instructions, Engineering Drawings and Manufacturing Process Specifications

Major functions:

Essential Functions

  • Assemble Electro-Mechanical parts and perform inner chassis wiring connections using various tools.
  • Assemble Magnetic assemblies through all stages of the process, from core and coil assembly to final assembly.
  • Assemble wood creates/pallets as needed/required
  • Perform simple to semi-complex cable assembly per shop order instructions and engineering drawing.
  • Basic understanding of standard hardware installation sequence.
  • Ability to read hardware descriptions on Engineering BOM and physically identify the characteristic of the hardware.
  • Ability to communicate issues, concerns and/or questions to his or her supervisors/managers and/or support groups (Manufacturing Engineering, Planning, Quality and Inspection).
  • Complies with company’s safety rules and regulations.
  • Responsible for the accuracy of time charging on job performed.
  • Responsible for keeping his or her work area clean and well organized.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by Management.
  • Able to pass soldering test and be certified ANSI-J-STD-001 as required.
  • Able to read and understand both written and verbal instructions in English

Technical Functional skills:

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or G.E.D
  • 4-6 years in related magnetic and/or electro-mechanical assembly related trainings, OR
  • 2 years post-Secondary/Associates Degree with a minimum of 2 years of prior related experience.
  • Solid experience with assembly blueprint reading.
  • Experience with hardware installation requirements.

NOTE: Due to the varying production requirements at the time of hire, this position may require soldering skills to Military specifications or ANSI-J-STD-001 in addition to mechanical/assembly skills or may require only mechanical/assembly skills. This is to be determined by the Manager/Supervisor based on the tasks and production needs.
